ltp_activity_data.name: Cooking with Maths
ltp_activity_data.text:
Cooking can help your boy or girl start learning maths!
💚 Invite your girl or boy to help you cook for your family, or to choose something they would like to cook 
;
🍅 Ask your boy or girl to count different ingredients. Help them if it’s difficult!

🔟 Help your girl or boy to understand adding and subtracting quantities 

📝 Encourage your boy or girl to recognise numbers on packaging

 👀 Ask your girl or boy about the different sizes of ingredients - e.g. which is bigger/biggest?
;
🔄 Think about when you will cook together again! You can also practise understanding numbers and quantities during other activities like shopping or building/making things

ltp_activity_data.name: Following Instructions
ltp_activity_data.text:
👂 Play a game in which your boy or girl listens to and tries to remember strings of instructions.
This will be useful in school, at home, and later in life!
;
Start with just one instruction using an object in your home. For example “touch the red ball” 🔴

Slowly add more instructions (e.g “then pick up the cup ☕), but tell your girl or boy that they can only start once you’ve finished giving the instructions.
See how many your boy or girl can follow without forgetting!
;
🔄 Now swap roles! It’s your boy or girl’s turn to give you instructions! They can use the same objects if they want.
You can also try this game with a group of girls and boys! Make sure they take turns :)

ltp_activity_data.name: One-on-One Time
ltp_activity_data.text:
💚 Spending time just with your girl or boy and taking an interest in them can improve your relationship. 
;
👀 When your boy or girl is playing alone or occupying themselves quietly, join them and show interest in what they are doing.

👂Ask questions about their activity, and listen to them.

Let your girl or boy lead the activity, follow them to build their confidence and autonomy 😃.

👀 Say what you see - describing everything and supporting your boy’s or girl’s actions.
;
Be positive, praise your girl or boy, and enjoy spending this time with them 😃💚

ltp_activity_data.name: Playtime with Books
ltp_activity_data.text:
📖 Book sharing will help your boy or girl learn and is a fun, playful activity to spend quality time together.

⏰ Choose a time when you won’t be disturbed, and try to stop any distractions - e.g. turn off the TV and put away phones.

📖 If your girl or boy wants to choose a book, that’s fine, otherwise choose for them.
;

💚 Sit close together and follow your boy or girl attention and lead. 
Point at things, name and repeat words. Help them to learn more about what interests them in the book 👀 
If there are words or numbers in the book, ask and help your girl or boy recognise letters numbers, and simple words 💡. 

Link things in the books to your child's life, and use words about emotions and talk about them! 😃.
;
🔄 If possible, start a regular routine to read together when your girl or boy isn’t too tired or hungry.
Reading together is one of the best ways to help your boy or girl learn and prepare for success in school! 🎓

ltp_activity_data.name: Playtime with Books
ltp_activity_data.text:
📖 Book sharing will help your girl or boy learn and is a fun, playful activity to spend quality time together

⏰ Choose a time when you won’t be disturbed, and try to stop any distractions - e.g. turn off the TV and put away phones

📖 If your boy or girl wants to choose a book, that’s fine, otherwise choose for them
;

💚 Sit close together and follow your girl or boy attention and lead 
Point at things, name and repeat words. Help them to learn more about what interests them in the book 👀 

Link things in the books to your child's life, and use words about emotions and talk about them! 😃
;
🔄 If possible, start a regular routine to read together when your girl or boy isn’t too tired or hungry
Reading together is one of the best ways to help your boy or girl learn and prepare for success in school! 🎓

ltp_activity_data.name: I Spy!
ltp_activity_data.text:
👀 I spy is a fun game to play with your girl or boy that will help them learn about letters and words!
;

Choose an object or a thing around you, and don’t tell your boy or girl what it is. It should be something that your boy or girl knows the word for. For example “ball” ⚽

👀 Then say “I spy with my little eye, something beginning with *and then say the first letter of the word* which in this case is “b”

Your girl or boy should look around and guess what the object is. When they guess it right, praise them and swap roles! If they can’t get it, give them some clues, like “it’s round” or “it’s black and white”. ✅
;

Play this game with as many objects as possible and as many different letters! Help your boy or girl to learn about the different letters and sounds in words. This will help them learn to read at home and school. 🎓

ltp_activity_data.name: Categorising and Organising
ltp_activity_data.text:
Help your girl or boy to learn by sorting objects and things! 🔵🔷

Your boy or girl will learn by understanding how things fit and group together (eg, bear = animal, mango = fruit, blue = colour) 🧸

Find a book with different pictures and help your girl or boy to find things in a particular category (e.g. “Find all of the animals”) 👀

Find *safe* objects in the house, get your boy or girl to group them by colour, size, or types of object (cups, plates). Then make more complicated categories (e.g. small cups, big cups) ☕
;
🔄 You can play the categorising game anywhere! Just look around and ask your girl or boy to find things from the category you say!

ltp_activity_data.name: What Letter is This?
ltp_activity_data.text:
Playing games with letters can help your boy or girl learn the alphabet and how letters are put together to make words.

📝 Write a letter on a piece of card or paper (e.g. “p”)

👂 Say the letter out loud and ask your girl or boy to say it too!

Ask your boy or girl to say some words that begin with the letter “p”, give them clues like “What starts with “p”? Plant… What else? 🌱

👀 Ask your girl or boy to look for objects in your house that begin with a letter (eg “p” for plate). Help them find things.
;
🔄 Try a new letter every day!

ltp_activity_data.name: Riddles Help Boys and Girls Learn
ltp_activity_data.text:
Riddles and puzzles are a fun way to build thinking skills! 💡
;
Do you remember any riddles from your childhood? If you can’t then make one up, they can be very simple! 😃
Like “What can you see at night but not in the day” Answer: “The moon” 🌙

If your girl or boy is finding them difficult, try an easy one like: “What is round, bouncy and can be thrown or kicked?” Answer: “A ball” ⚽

Your boy or girl can also try making riddles! 💡
;
You can have fun with riddles anywhere at any time - like traveling on a bus, walking to school or in a car 🚗

ltp_activity_data.name: What's New?
ltp_activity_data.text:
Learning is fun! 🎓

❓ Ask your girl or boy to think of a new, fun skill you could learn together. 
For example: keeping a ball in the air with your foot, juggling, making soup, moonwalking, whistling, saying the alphabet backwards, learning all the states in Mexico. 

🔄 Take turns trying out the new skill. Make sure to praise each other and learn and play together!

💛 Approach learning the skill in a kind and fun way, and do not judge your boy or girl or yourself for your ability in the skill. 

😃 Once you have mastered the skill, choose another skill to learn together.

ltp_activity_data.name: Make up a Story
ltp_activity_data.text:
Creating stories together is a great way to have fun with imagination - and to build your girl or boy’s creativity! 📖
;
5️⃣ With your boy or girl, come up with 5 words to use. They can be any words you want! For example: banana, spaceship, fish, water, painting, cooking, wedding. If you need to remember them, write them clearly on a paper with your girl or boy.

🎂 Start your story with, “Once upon a time, there was a…” and use one of the words from the list in the first part. For example, “Once upon a time, there was a family who worked on a *banana* farm.”

📝 Let your boy or girl make up the next part using another word from the list.
;
🔄 Take turns until you have used all the words and created a story. 

🔔 Be creative and do not tell your girl or boy what to say. It does not need to be a real story to be fun!

🎁 Ask your boy or girl what their favourite part of the story was, and tell them yours!

ltp_activity_data.name: Playing with Clothes
Playing with Vegetables
ltp_activity_data.text:
🌱 Help your girl or boy learn by thinking and talking about vegetables!

🍅 Mix together 2-3 different ingredients of your choice (like onions, tomatoes and corn example). Say: “Help me sort these vegetables into piles?” Try sorting them by size.
;
😃 Remind me!
Talk about your child’s experiences. Ask questions and wait for answers. Follow your child’s interests. 
“Can you help me remember what is at the market?” “Do they sell carrots at the market?” “Do they sell anything yellow at the market?” “What else do they sell?” “Can you think of other things they sell?”
;
💡Can you think of something similar?
Say: We are going to think of some things that are similar or different from what I tell you. So listen carefully!”
Here is a tomato. Can you think of something else that is red like a tomato? 🍅
Can you think of something else that is round like a tomato? ⚽

ltp_activity_data.name: Animals
ltp_activity_data.text:
🧸 Active animals: Take turns with Your Child doing animal actions: Hop like a frog, stretch like a cat, run like a dog, slither like a snake, flap like a bird
;
💡All the animals we can think of - think about groups of animals!
What are all the animals we can think of that have feathers?
What are all the animals we can think of that eat plants? 🌱
What are all the animals we can think of that lay eggs?
;
😃 Counting rabbits
🔟 Find 10 rocks and put them in a line, tell your girl or boy that they are rabbits!
Ask them to count the rabbits!
Put the rabbits into 2 equal piles. Ask your boy or girl to give you 3 rabbits. Say “If you give me 3, how many rabbits do you have?”

ltp_activity_data.name: Active Counting
ltp_activity_data.text:
👋 Clap, hop, jump: Play the following game with Your Child. Make it active!

1️⃣ Clap hands 1 time. 2️⃣ Clap hands 2 times.
1️⃣ Jump 1 time. 2️⃣ Jump 2 times.
1️⃣ Hop 1 time.
3️⃣ Hop 3 times.
💡Can you hop, then jump, then clap? 
🏆 Can you clap twice, jump once, and hop three times?
;
💡Remembering Instructions
Take turns playing a game where you give 2-3 instructions that the other person has to remember to follow. Make sure physical movement is included!
For example:
Hop twice, turn around.
Jump to the kitchen, pick up a spoon, then run back. ✅

ltp_activity_data.name: Thinking Games
ltp_activity_data.text:
❗ Mama/Daddy says! Play this game of giving instructions:
Mama/daddy says touch your head. Mama/daddy says open your mouth. Mama/daddy says turn around. Mama/daddy says touch your knees. Mama/daddy says jump twice. Mama/daddy says jump, then clap and sit.
;
👂 Go and stop: Play the game with Your Child
Say: When I say “stop”, we freeze. When I say “go”, we can walk again.
Once Your Child is familiar with the game, Your Child will lead.
;
🔵 🔴Blue-Red - now play this game!
If I say touch something blue, you need to touch something red. If I say touch something red, you need to touch something blue.

ltp_activity_data.name: Games with Pictures!
ltp_activity_data.text:
👂 Making up a story from an image
For example, say: We are going to make up a story about this picture. I can start. This little girl is feeling very excited today. Why do you think she is feeling excited?
😃 She is holding her bag and has a big smile. Where do you think she is going?
;
👀 Can you point to it?
Using a book or a magazine, or anything with pictures, say:
I am going to describe something on the page and you need to guess what it is and point to it. For example, “I see something that is [green and moves slowly].
Can you guess what it is?” 💚

ltp_activity_data.name: Shapes Everywhere!
ltp_activity_data.text:
📺 Squares, squares everywhere

👀 Draw squares in the sand or dirt. Make some bigger and some smaller.
Tell Your Child, “this is a square.” 
Ask your girl or boy to try to draw a square. Hold your boy’s or girl’s hand to help if this is hard. 
Look for things around the home or outdoors that are the same shape.

Now do the same with circles! 🔴

ltp_activity_data.name: Story Telling
ltp_activity_data.text:
💡 Let’s make a story!

Say: We are going to make up a story. I will start then you will help me continue it. 
⏰ ”Once upon a time there was…”
“What happened next?”👀
“What happened after that?”
;

👂 Tell me the story!
Say to Your Child: “I have a book here that we have read before. Can you remember the story and tell it to me just by looking at the pictures?” 
👀 Show your girl or boy pictures in the book. Ask your boy or girl what is happening in the pictures and what happens next.

ltp_activity_data.name: I'm a Writer!
ltp_activity_data.text:
📝 Have fun being creative with writing!

You and Your Child can have fun writing with a pencil and paper, or with a stick and the sand!
If your girl or boy doesn’t know how to write letters, encourage them to draw shapes, and try to copy the shapes of letters. 🔵▶️

When they are more confident, encourage them to write letters and even words. 😃Start showing them how to write their name and other important words for them, like mom, ball or milk.

Show them the simple things that you write - like shopping lists! Show them the words and each of the letters. Let them try to copy the words! 📖

ltp_activity_data.name: A Friendly Chat
ltp_activity_data.text:
Talk to your girl or boy about something that they are interested in! 😃

💚 Spending quality time with your boy or girl and talking to them every day is a good way to develop a strong relationship. 

⚽ An easy way to start talking to your girl or boy is to ask them about something they are interested in, for example you could talk about topics such as: sports, books, movies, friends, music, celebrities, or school.

👂 You may not find everything your boy or girl shares to be interesting, but it’s important to show enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn.

ltp_activity_data.name: Get Active
ltp_activity_data.text:
Exercise is a great way to spend time together and it is so good for your health. 🌱 Find a sport or exercise that both you and your girl or boy want to do and try it out together! 

⏰ Even walking for 10 minutes a day is good for you. 

⚽ Together you can walk, run, play soccer, swim, dance, or do any other sport..

🏆 Together, think of ways to make it even more fun. Can you jog to a certain point? Take turns being the coach? Can there be a small, free reward, like getting to decide the next activity?

🌈 Exercise becomes easier and more enjoyable the more you do it. 

🔄 If you or your girl or boy do not like the first exercise you pick, try a new exercise.

ltp_activity_data.name: Pass the Ball
ltp_activity_data.text:
Games are a great, fun way to spend time with your family! 

3️⃣ This game is best with at least 3 people.

⚽ Find a ball to play. If you cannot find a ball, choose an item you can safely throw around. For example, a bottle cap or a plastic cup.

➡️ Start in a circle and pass the ball around. 

👋 Start throwing the ball in new directions (up, down, straight, curved, rolling on the ground) and with different forces (hard, soft, medium). You can bounce the ball, throw it in the air, and catch it a few times before passing it. 

✨ When everyone gets good at catching the ball, you can start moving around the room, still passing the ball. 

⭐ Can you throw the ball under the leg? Behind the back? Over your head? Block a pass? Have fun with it!

ltp_activity_data.name: Active Songs
ltp_activity_data.text:
😃 Young boys and girls love physical games! But they need reminders about how to play 💡
🎵 Songs with movements are fun and active and give instructions on how to move!
;
Sing songs to Your Child or a group of girls and boys in which they have to:
✅ Start and stop ❌
⬇️ Slow down and speed up ⬆️

ltp_activity_data.name: Follow the Leader!
ltp_activity_data.text:
⭐ Choose someone to be the leader (tip: start with an adult like yourself)
😃 Other players line up behind the leader. The leader moves around in any way they like!
🏁 They can run, jump, crawl, walk on tiptoe, and any other way they want!
👀 The other players must copy what the leader does, and the leader can change movements at any time.

🔄 Players take turns being the leader!

ltp_activity_data.name: Be the Narrator
ltp_activity_data.text:
👀 Say what your girl or boy is doing while they are playing

👂 This will help them learn the words to describe their actions.

😃 You can do it in a simple way, or in a silly way like a sports commentator, a news presenter, or a game show host

💡 Ask questions like “what will you do next?” or “I see you want to put the ball in the jar. Is there another way to do that?”

ltp_activity_data.name: Be an Artist!
ltp_activity_data.text:
📝 Give Your Child some paper and a pen or pencil, or some different pens or pencils.
😃 Let your girl or boy draw whatever they want to!
👀 Ask questions about what they are drawing, the size of the thing they are drawing, and the colours they are using.

🏆 If possible, put your boy or girl’s picture up on the wall when they are finished. Give praise to your girl or boy!

ltp_activity_data.name: Be an Expert in Emotions!
ltp_activity_data.text:
📝 Create an album of the six emotions with Your Child: happy, sad, angry, disgusted, surprised, afraid.

Draw, cut-out pictures from magazines, or take photos of family members showing different emotions. 

Label each emotion and add words about how each family member feels those emotions. 

Put the album in a spot everyone agrees on, and use it throughout the day to show how the family is feeling. For example, after school, everyone can pin the emotion they’re experiencing. 

Feel free to add new feelings as they come up. If someone doesn’t know what they are feeling, help them identify it by exploring how it feels in their body. Try together to find a new word for that emotion.

This can help everyone in the family become experts in understanding themselves and be aware of what their bodies need.
